articles.headline: Trade War in Solar Takes Shape
articles.snippet: Chinese solar panel manufacturers, which had virtually no presence in the American market three years ago, now hold more than half of it.
articles.abstract: Chinese solar panel manufacturers, which had virtually no presence in the American market three years ago, now hold more than half of it.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The United States and China are gearing up for a trade war that could catch American users of solar energy in the crossfire.

articles.headline: 7 Charged in Web Scam Using Ads
articles.snippet: Federal prosecutors charged seven men with orchestrating an Internet scheme that infected more than four million computers with malicious software and generated profits through online advertisements.
articles.abstract: Federal prosecutors charged seven men with orchestrating an Internet scheme that infected more than four million computers with malicious software and generated profits through online advertisements.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was a subtle swap: a cheesy advertisement for a vacation timeshare site atop the home page of ESPN.com, in a spot that might have been claimed by a well-known brand like Dr Pepper.
articles.byline: By Somini Sengupta and Jenna Wortham

articles.headline: A Monitor of Health, Worn Lightly
articles.snippet: Jawbone offers the Up wristband, which monitors your sleep and activities and also provides a visual record of your habits.
articles.abstract: Jawbone offers the Up wristband, which monitors your sleep and activities and also provides a visual record of your habits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Maybe you’ve heard. We Americans are not, ahem, the very models of physical fitness. We’re overweight, underexercised and underslept.

articles.headline: Corporate Japan Rocked by Scandal at Olympus
articles.snippet: The company has lost three-quarters of its value since the accusations were made and faces several investigations and possible delisting from the Tokyo exchange.
articles.abstract: The company has lost three-quarters of its value since the accusations were made and faces several investigations and possible delisting from the Tokyo exchange.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — In June 1998, a disturbing rumor tore through trading floors in Tokyo: Olympus had suffered colossal losses on derivatives trading, punching a large hole in its balance sheet. The company’s shares spiraled down 11 percent in three days.

articles.headline: Google’s Chief Works to Trim a Bloated Ship
articles.snippet: Larry Page returned to the helm of Google to find it bloated, unwieldy and hard to move quickly. He’s working to change all that.
articles.abstract: Larry Page returned to the helm of Google to find it bloated, unwieldy and hard to move quickly. He’s working to change all that.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif. — Larry Page, Google’s chief executive, so hates wasting time at meetings that he once dumped his secretary to avoid being scheduled for them. He does not much like e-mail either — even his own Gmail — saying the tedious back-and-forth takes too long to solve problems.

articles.headline: Euro Fears Spread to Italy as the Debt Crisis Deepens
articles.snippet: Italy, the euro zone’s third-largest economy, struggled to find a new government as investors drove Italian bond rates above 7 percent.
articles.abstract: Italy, the euro zone’s third-largest economy, struggled to find a new government as investors drove Italian bond rates above 7 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Since the start of the euro crisis two years ago, the big fear has been contagion, that market unease about the high debt and slow growth in Europe’s southern rim would infect the core. On Wednesday, contagion arrived with brute force.

articles.headline: Cain’s Lawyer on Accusing: ‘Think Twice’
articles.snippet: Herman Cain’s lawyer said other women coming forward with harassment claims would face intense scrutiny.
articles.abstract: Herman Cain’s lawyer said other women coming forward with harassment claims would face intense scrutiny.
articles.lead_paragraph: L. Lin Wood, the lawyer hired by the Republican presidential candidate Herman Cain to fend off sexual harassment accusations, has warned that any other women who might be considering coming forward with similar allegations “should think twice.”

articles.headline: After ‘Oops’ in Debate, Perry Says He’ll Stay in Race
articles.snippet: A day after an embarrassing stumble, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said he had no intention of leaving the race, despite stinging G.O.P. criticism.
articles.abstract: A day after an embarrassing stumble, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said he had no intention of leaving the race, despite stinging G.O.P. criticism.
articles.lead_paragraph: ROCHESTER, Mich. —   A day after an embarrassing stumble raised new questions about his presidential candidacy, Gov. Rick Perry of Texas said Thursday that he had no intention of leaving the race, and he tried using humor to deflect a fresh round of stinging Republican criticism.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Ashley Parker
